content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: it is a good problem with a good explanation of the subject and a well defined tests

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice task, easy to solve, yet fun.
why not approve it? is there any problem i can't see ?. plz comment it, and thx for your time.

Input
* Please rewrite as follows:
<<Line 1>>: A string [[garbage]] for the characters that you need to remove.
<<Line 2>>: A string [[message]] to remove characters from

Constraints
* Please rewrite as follows:
0 ≤ length([[garbage]]) ≤ 50
1 ≤ length([[message]]) ≤ 50

Cases
* Please revise the cases so that each pair of test and validator are similar. Currently the first two pairs of cases are not similar:

• Test 1: [[garbage]] contains unique lowercase letters only

• Validator 1: [[garbage]] contains unique digits only

• Test 2: [[garbage]] contains duplicated digits

• Validator 2: [[garbage]] contains one uppercase letter only

Also, the situation where none of the [[garbage]] characters can be found in [[message]] is not covered in any cases. The situation where only a different letter case of a character found in [[garbage]] can be found in [[message]] is not covered either.

You have to add more pairs of cases to cover different situations adequately.

Thanks.

Better, but there are still some necessary fixes:

* Validator 1: Please change "xzxyxzxkxzxyxzx" so that some (not all) of the x, y and z letters are in uppercase.

* Add a new pair of cases (Test 7, Validator 7) where:
  • [[garbage]] contains lowercase letters, uppercase letters, digits and special characters.
  • [[message]] contains all characters in [[garbage]]. Each should appear more than once, and the lettercase must be totally opposite (e.g. if [[garbage]] contains "h" and "R", then [[message]] contains "H" and "r" only).

Thanks.

hmm, I hope it doesn't look too overwhelming ?
anyway what about now ?
